p:
Turner et al. identified that the SARS-CoV receptor, ACE2, undergoes proteolytic shedding, releasing an enzymatically active ectodomain during viral entry.
75 Further research identified that a disintegrin and metalloproteinase (ADAM17) is responsible for shedding regulation of ACE2. Inhibiting ADAM activity with the ADAM-specific inhibitor GW280264X ( 6) reduced shedding of ACE2 at 1 nM against SARS-CoV.
76 Another enzyme involved in ACE2 shedding is TACE (TNF-Î± converting enzyme, a member of the ADAM family). Two TACE inhibitors, TAPI-0 ( 7) and TAPI-2 ( 8), reduced ACE2 shedding against SARS-CoV, with IC 50 values of 100 and 200 nM, respectively.
75
